meanings.definition: Stop the continuous progress of an activity or process.
meanings.sent1: Please do not interrupt the class while the teacher is speaking.
meanings.sent2: I had to interrupt my work to answer an important phone call.
meanings.sent3: It can be frustrating to interrupt a game right before reaching the final level.
meanings.sent4: The sudden rainstorm interrupted our picnic plans.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise outside interrupted my concentration.

meanings.definition: Stop the continuous progress of a conversation or speech.
meanings.sent1: It's rude to interrupt someone while they are talking.
meanings.sent2: I didn't mean to interrupt your story, but I have a question.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to interrupt our discussion by meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter interrupted the serious tone of the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The phone call interrupted our deep conversation about life.

meanings.definition: Break the continuity of a line or surface.
meanings.sent1: The fence was interrupted by a large tree growing through it.
meanings.sent2: The straight road was interrupted by a sharp turn.
meanings.sent3: The pattern on the fabric was interrupted by a misplaced stitch.
meanings.sent4: The smooth surface of the lake was interrupted by ripples from the wind.
meanings.sent5: The flow of the river was interrupted by a massive boulder.
